CAREER SUMMARY  
 
2015 to Present : Action International Service, Dubai, UAE  
Position: Regional HR Manager – GCC  
 
Formulate HR corporate strategy and KPIs. Promote the right business behaviours 
and values. Support communication strategies, organizational growth, and legal 
setup across the region. Devise business strategy f or performance management, 
staffing, compensation and benefits, training, and development to increase 
efficiency. Review and examine the internal policies and standards to meet global 
and local standards. Receive and resolve employees’ relation matter and labour/legal 
concerns in timely manner, Support commercial disputes, while working as member 
of the executive team..  
• Manage entire HR initiatives and tactics in line with the corporate strategy of 
company.  
    
• Develop process improvement projects to enha nce efficiency and effectiveness. 
HRIS, sales incentives schemes, competency mapping, Hays’ job evaluation  
• Cost management across various segments, medical insurances, facilities and 
benefits.  
 
 
2014 to 2015 : DNV GL (Det Norskie Veritas), Dubai, UAE  
Position: Regional HR Mana ger- MENAI  
 
Managed leadership development programme and monitoring process for individual 
development and succession planning to improve the staff performance. Designed 
HR policies and procedures in compliance with the company’s standard a nd local 
regulations. Created effective retention plan, employee engagement strategies, and 
compensation and benefits structure based on business setup. Delivered training to 
the managers about using and utilising HR applications and software. Administered  
HR budget plan and reported HR data to the Global and Region Managers. Structures 
and delivered Middle East and North Africa compensation harmonisation project for 
the Oil/Gas division.  
 Compensation and benefits alignment project across the MENA region   
 Field staff succession planning  
 
 
2012 to 2014 : Weatherford International, Dubai UAE  
Position: Regional HR Manager, IRAQ Region  
 
Established retention plan and employee engagement strategies as well as re -
structured employees’ benefits to meet job protocols. Provisioned assistance to the 
Engineering Procurement Construction (EPC) project and monitored project 
requirements. Maintaine d HR scorecard. Headed the activities of training 
department, including internal training requirements and clients’ training needs. 
Tracked headcount, revenue per product lines, enable growth and efficient work 
force plan. Formulated HR strategic Plan to a ttain business objectives by managing 
the head count of 2,500 employees.  
 Implement work force plan and recruitment strategies for USD1.2b Project.  
 Grading and compensation project with Mercer and HR system data clean -up  
 Structured HR teams across various areas including site HR support  
 
 
2008 to 2012 : Baker Hughes Incorporated, Dubai UAE  
Position: Geo-Market HR Manager, Gulf Region  
 
Prepared and reported geo -market workforce scorecards to the VP -operations and 
regional HR director with 1, 245 employees. B uilt relationships, improved service 
level, and analysed impact to business for revenue enhancement. Influence the 
senior management team in developing HR strategies and plans to improve the 
business. Organised and deployed a performance management culture  by ensuring 
    
clear objectives and focusing on areas for improvement. Facilitate culture and 
people aspects of organisational change, structure, and improvement initiatives.  
 Improved HR processes, integration and alignment for a massive business 
acquisit ion project.  
 Maintained HR/legal compliance with global practices and aligned with local 
requirements.  
 Formed reports on revenue/employee, engineer development, compensation 
cost, and attrition.  
 
 
COMMENTS  
 
Strong background in formulating and executing HR plans, supporting the company’s 
strategic goals. Talent management, identifying training needs, Job evaluation, 
design benefits, negotiating agreements, developing budgets, raising legal and 
compliance awareness. Possess solid management skill s and ability to analyse issues, 
devise continuous process improvements, and incorporate initiatives to increase 
efficiency across the business.
